column4: I'm installing Ubuntu (Hardy Heron) and it's reading my 80gb hdd as  a 40 gb hdd.  Please Help.
I'm sorry, I don't know what dd is.  I'm something of a newb.
do you have anything installed in the hard drive?
are you sure you are looking at the entire drive and not just the partition
type "sudo fdisk -l" and use pastebin to give me the output
that is how much free space is on that disk.. and since you have both windows and ubuntu installed on it.. you'll definately not have an empty drive..
is ubuntu the only OS installed?
it should be.  A long time ago this disk had XP on it.
are you sure it is an 80GB HDD? does the bios see it as 80GB?
This might be a bios problem, you're right.  It says 80gb on the case, and when it had XP it had 80gb too.
it says 80gb (or the equivalent in bytes) directly on the drive.
maybe you have lost sectors and filesystems..
Hidden is unlikely, I'm the original owner of this drive.

you can use a utility called "testdisk" to make sure everything is ok.. but it is a very powerful program and used improperly can basically damage your filesystem beyond recovery.. you could ask for help here for someone who knows how to use it.. or read up on it.
